etymology.description: 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic component 暵 or 熯 -> refers to river in China 漢江/漢水 -> simplified by removing components to form 又(又) (yòu, "again")
etymology.interpretation: The character 漢 initially depicts the Han River with water radical 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") and a phonetic element. Its simplification to 汉 involved reducing complexity by retaining the 又(又) (yòu, "again") shape, reflecting modern streamlining efforts.
etymology.simplification: 汉(漢) was simplified by eliminating components, retaining the shape 又(又) (yòu, "again"), a common simplification strategy to reduce strokes.

examples.chinese: 他学习汉字(他學習漢字)，了解汉文化(了解漢文化)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuéxí hànzì, liǎojiě hàn wénhuà.
examples.english: He studies Chinese characters and learns about Chinese culture.
